newsitem.title: USA: BPA offers Tues non-firm peak power at $11-12/MWh.
newsitem.headline: BPA offers Tues non-firm peak power at $11-12/MWh.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) offered next-day power during peak and off-peak hours for the first time in more than a week, the agency said Monday.

For Tuesday pre-schedulings, BPA offered non-firm power during hours ending 1200-1700 PDT and 2100-2200 PDT at $11.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for Northwest deliveries and $12.00 for California-Oregon border (COB) deliveries.
Non-firm power for hours ending 0600 PDT and 2300 PDT was offered at $9.50 for all deliveries, while supplies during off-peak hours ending 0100-0500 PDT and 2400 PDT was offered at $9.00.
Firm power during off-peak hours on Tuesday was also offered at $9.00.
BPA placed no volume limits on the sales offers.
